did.unittitle: New Jersey Bell Telephone Company and Communications Workers of America, New Jersey Traffic Division #55 Records,
did.origination: New Jersey Bell Telephone Company; Communications Workers of America (CWA)
did.repository: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: This case deals primarily with the constitutionality of the New Jersey statute providing for compulsory arbitration of public utility labor disputes. The constitutional issues involved were whether the statute invades a field preempted by the Federal Government; does the statute improperly delegate legislative power under vague standards, and is it a denial of due process.

scopecontent.p: This case deals primarily with the constituionality of the New Jersey statute providing for compulsory arbitration of public utility labor disputes.

The constitutional issues involved were whether the statute invades a field preempted by the Federal Government; does the statute improperly delegate legislative power under vague standards, and is it a denial of due process.
